attributes.action:
Provide CCTV in all Care homes (
Special Needs, Disabled, Dementia, Elderly)
attributes.background: I am a single mum with a son who has autism and should he live in a care home, when i am no longer around, I want him to be protected and all his care to be recorded in case of negligence or abuse.

attributes.action: Invest more money into scientific research to find the cause of M.E / CFS
attributes.background: M.E./CFS is a debilitating autoimmune disease currently affecting 250,000 people in the UK. Many sufferers are unable to work or care for themselves, and 25% of M.E. patients are bedbound. Most M.E. sufferers are on ESA or disability benefits, causing a significant economic burden.
attributes.additional_details: No universally effective treatment exists for M.E. Current NHS treatments for the illness are based on the controversial PACE trial, and have been found ineffective or even harmful. Good quality research into the root cause of the illness is needed. The current annual budget for biomedical research works at roughly £1 per patient per year. We want the budget for research to be dramatically increased. We also ask for the formation of a work group focussing on the issues surrounding this disease.

attributes.action: Impose Levy for Football clubs in the Premier/Football League for Play Areas
attributes.background:
Recent discussion about Local Authorities trying to maintain Play Areas and their possibly being forced to cut funding.
The huge sums of money available to these professional football clubs should ensure that our young people are given good places to play and keep fit.
attributes.additional_details: Recent reports in the media which imply Local Authorities may have to cut back on Play facilities.

attributes.action: For Corby to have their own hospital.
attributes.background: We have the urgent care centre in Corby, also known as 8-8. Who claim to have the resources of a hospital like KGH, but they do not. They lack observing sick patients. Mainly young children, to the point where they don't carry out the right tests to determine if that patient is really sick.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I have is my own son, who may I quote is only 1 in a few days. I recently took him to the urgent care centre on the 5/12/16, because his lack of breathing and chesty cough. I was sat there for four hours to only be told he's fine and his chest is clear. He had no observations done. The next day my son was rushed to hospital and I was told he was lacking oxygen really bad (65 out of 100 to be persist) he then had to have 5ml of steroids (oral) 8-8 failed my little boy.

attributes.action: Every private members bill allotted a debate is guaranteed to be put to a vote
attributes.background: The filibustering associated with the Turing Bill was an example of too much power concentrated in the hands of a few ministers. Any MP should be able to put bills before parliament, have them debated and voted upon. We need a proper constitution but this would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents not to vaccinate a child
attributes.background:
Not vaccinating your children makes two things more likely
- Your child will get sick
- Your child will spread that illness to other unprotected children, some of whom may be too young to have received the necessary vaccination.
Therefore, not getting your child vaccinated is grossly negligent.
attributes.additional_details: Herd immunity is the primary reason for mass immunisation - in layman's terms, it means that the more people are immunised against a given disease, the less that disease will be able to spread, and more people (especially children too young to receive that specific vaccination) will be safe from it. We call on the government to criminalise non-vaccinating parents who refuse an initial order to vaccinate.

attributes.action: Raise the appalling level of farm murders with the South African Government.
attributes.background: The terrible toll of violent attacks and murders against South African farmers and other xenophobic attacks must be brought to the attention of the South African government.
attributes.additional_details: South Africa has one of the highest murder rates in the world.  Attacks against farmers and other non indigenous peoples are out of all proportion to their population numbers.  Over 40 attacks on farms in February alone.

attributes.action: Scrap 'killer' diesel cars and compensate owners misled by Government advice.
attributes.background:
From 2001-2015 the UK public were encouraged by Government to buy diesel cars as they were better for the environment.
Now, those cars might be banned because of an estimated 23,500 premature deaths a year.
A scrappage scheme would protect health & compensate well-meaning owners who were misled.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Chancellor reduced VED in 2001 for cars with low CO2 emissions, and the scrappage scheme of 2009, the UK public were encouraged to buy ‘cleaner diesels’.

In 2015 Lord Drayson said that Government "made a mistake" in encouraging diesel ownership.

We need these vehicles off our roads, but well-intentioned current owners were badly misled by the Government, and will suffer financially, being unable to sell their vehicles, or use them freely due to proposals to limit their use.

attributes.action: Stop GCSE Maths needed for a Level 3 where someone has the SpLD dyscalculia.
attributes.background: How are people with an SpLD supposed to advance in their chosen career if they constantly face hurdles.  They do not get enough support in education as it is without having to face battle after battle.
attributes.additional_details: My 21 year old has a diagnosis of dyscalculia.  At school she got a GCSE Grade E in maths and has no understanding of the subject.  She has a L2 qualification in childcare and wants to progress in her chosen career by taking a L3.  She can begin the course but will not pass until she gets a C in maths. This is discrimination.

attributes.action: Respond to US Executive Order banning people from Muslim countries entering USA
attributes.background: Until the order is revoked, UK must pledge: To call on US govt to reverse the ban; No US-UK government visits; No talks on US-UK trade & migration; Full legal support to UK citizens & businesses affected; To welcome refugees refused entry to USA; To stand up for religious freedom and human rights
attributes.additional_details: On 27 January 2017, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order putting in place a 90-day block on entry to the US from citizens from Iran, Iraq, Syria, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia. The ban applies to those already settled in the US as well as those travelling there, and people in transit (including at least 1 child) have been detained at airports on the US border within 24 hours of signature. UK citizens are also covered by the ban if they are connected with one of these countries.

attributes.action: Introduce preferential voting to UK general and local elections.
attributes.background: Preferential voting is a voting system that allows voters to rank their choices of candidate in order of preference (see: "instant-runoff voting" in Australia). Such a system is very helpful in preventing the so-called "two-horse race" issue that is common in first-past-the-post voting systems.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's voting system is known as a "first-past-the-post" system. It means that one can only vote for a single candidate, and, as has been the case in recent elections at home and abroad, this means that one is unable to vote for their interests as any vote for a third party is wasted, and may even serve to split the vote and see an unpopular candidate win. Preferential voting allows one to vote as they wish, rather than being forced to vote strategically against their least-favoured candidate.

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: Eliminate the state pension & benefits to pay for the costs of brexit
attributes.background: It is unfair for the costs of exiting the EU and any financial risk to our economy to be paid for by the young & employed.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of setting up & running the Department of Exiting the EU & any subsequent downturn in the economy should be paid for by eliminating the state pension, job seekers allowance, pension credit etc. Any future downturn in government tax receipts due to recession should be paid for by eliminating these programs before increasing VAT or pay roll taxes.

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Give all animal abusers a proper and minimum length sentence, not just a fine.
attributes.background: I have seen may stories of animal abusers and neglecters getting away with just a fine. I believe and demand they should be given a full proper minimum sentence term as a punishment for what they have done. Animals have feelings, not just physical but emotional and mental scars. Please sign, share.
attributes.additional_details: There have been many videos on Facebook going around of animal being abused and the criminals have only being given a fine which is just not enough. They should be punished like any other criminal for the harm that they have done. Animals can suffer the emotional and mental torture for the criminals have done. This is not fair for somebody who is voiceless and cant escape, only cry, squeal, be scared, shaking and trapped. This is wrong. Please sign, share and tweet.

attributes.action: Make the act of child grooming illegal in England and Wales
attributes.background: Breck Bednar, 14 was murdered by someone he met online at their first meeting. At the moment the police can only arrest offenders if they meet the children they groom online. This would have been too late for Breck, so it is imperative police are able press charges before children are put in danger.
attributes.additional_details: The legislation was endorsed by Mrs May while she was Home Secretary, but unfortunately still has not been enacted into law and has been waiting for two years. Meanwhile thousands of predators are thought to have gone unpunished as police can only arrest them if they are known to meet the children they groom online. The new law would make it illegal for an adult to send sexual communication to a child. This law will make the act of child grooming illegal in England and Wales.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the investment in our beleaguered NHS
attributes.background: The Department for Transport says the HS2 project will cut Birmingham-London journey times from 1hr 21min to 49min. Big deal - how about cutting patient waiting times in A&E departments by 32 minutes! Austerity measures should include cancelling non-essential investment - Get the NHS back on track!
attributes.additional_details: According to some experts the estimated cost of HS2 has risen dramatically and could now be as high as £90bn. Why not invest in the NHS and build new efficient world class hospitals. At the same time the government should invest more in recruitment and training of doctors and nurses so that they do not have to work all hours of the day. I have been advised that it takes 7 years to build a new hospital from inception to completion. We need our government to address the shortcomings of the NHS NOW

attributes.action: All visitors to the UK should pay an entry charge of £20 per adult.
attributes.background: Many states such as the USA, Mexico and many Caribbean islands apply a visitor charge. If the UK applied a charge to all adult visitors we would raise hundreds of £millions, this revenue could be used to enhance and strengthen our Border, Customs, Immigration, Security and Intelligence services.
attributes.additional_details:
Mexico charge a flat £60 tourist tax, the USA charge £14 for an ESTA to gain admittance, many other states now charge visitors to either enter or leave their country.
The UK Border, Immigration and Customs agencies face challenging workloads on tight budgets. Likewise our Security and Intelligence services could be better funded to keep our country more secure and safer.
If a charge of say £20 were applied to all adult visitors the UK would raise substantial revenues which could fund the above.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of Rotherham main post office
attributes.background:
Rotherham as you know has had bad press,
For the people of  our town many things have disappeared that once made this town a good place to live, buildings pulled down without consulting the people, 
now the main Rotherham post office  (3-5 Bridgegate) is next to be hit,
please put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
this post office is a necessity for the people of Rotherham.
a lot of people including the elderly  use this post office and in turn helps local trade as some have it as part of a day in the town center. it is necessary for passports, driving licenses, pensions ect ect, Rotherham as a town is slowly disappearing and it needs to be stopped, a once proud people are now seeing Rotherham town center disappear, contrary to popular belief not everyone has the internet and still need this post office

attributes.action: PLEASE GIVE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO TIER 1 ENTREPRENEUR INITIAL & EXTENSION VISA
attributes.background: Our request to all Honourable UK Parliament members is that please restore the right of appeal for Tier 1 entrepreneur applicants if refused due to errors, Appeal right defend the applicants and allow them to provide solid evidence against the raised issues
attributes.additional_details: Applicants can apply for an administrative review of the Tier 1 entrepreneur refusal decision if they think that Home Office has made an error in considering their application.When they apply for administrative review, no evidence is allowed to forward in favour of the refused application. This means that if Home Office maintained the refused decision then they order applicants to leave the country ASAP and they could lose their running business and investment that could ruin their future

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: Require the Department of Health to review outdated (1988) Child Growth Chart
attributes.background: Infants and Children's weight in the UK is measured on an outdated growth chart formulated in 1988 based on formula fed babies and children in 1988. This is wrongly leading to children and babies being "labelled" as obese from birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for this petition as today my health visitor advised me that my child who was born just above the 75th centile for weight and above the 98th centile for height is "overweight".  (Despite being breastfed on demand for 16 months of his life, as per best advice to breastfeed for the first year.)
Despite this the Health Visitor tells me that at any contact with a health professional we are likely to be advised about regulating his weight.

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: We are asking UK government to impose sanctions on Gabon
attributes.background:
One of the most concerning aspects of the crisis relate to the constant
human rights abuses and violence.    Ali Bongo didn't win the elections in August 2016.
attributes.additional_details: https://eeas.europa.eu/election-observation-missions/eom-gabon/421/election-observation-missions-eueoms_en MEPs question President Bongo’s legitimacy, noting that the official 2016 presidential election results are "non-transparent and highly doubtful". They are deeply concerned about the unfolding violence which followed the proclamation of the results. UK must take up matter and trigger the Cotonou agreement and E.U Resolution on Rule of Law crisis in Gabon adopted on 1st of February 2017.

attributes.action: Ensure that visitors to the UK have medical insurance for their stay.
attributes.background: Medical attention given to overseas visitors (inc health tourism) is a drain on the NHS. The Border Agency should develop a method to ensure that visitors with visas also have appropriate medical insurance to cover them for their stay. The NHS could recover some of the £2B spent on overseas visitors
attributes.additional_details:
The combined cost of "deliberate health tourism" and unintentional visitor use of the NHS is estimated to be £2 billion per annum. No system is likely to be foolproof but every effort should be made to recover as much of that money as possible. Any recovered money should go directly to the relevant NHS trust.
Only 5% of that amount, £100 million, was recovered in 2013/14.

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for child rape
attributes.background: A child who is raped has the rest of their life to face in ruins and turmoil due to what has happend to them. So why do we have such light sentences for it. With this crime increasing daily it should now have the sentence of life in prison to help prevent this awful act.

attributes.action: Factor wealth and assets outside of salary into CMS calculation & remove cap.
attributes.background:
Legal loophole allows wealthy fathers to pay nothing for their children;
The CMS doesn't look at assets or wealth outside of salary therefore individuals paid via dividends/international income streams are outside of its jurisdiction. Salary above £156k not factored in, disadvantaging children.
attributes.additional_details:
Schedule 1 of the Children's Act used to provide an alternative assessment pathway but mothers questing for justice are at the mercy of UK law; things have gone from bad to worse since a case led to Judges not applying Schedule 1 of the Children's Act until a tribunal hearing via the CMS has been reached and won; seemingly impossible to do when the CMS don't look at wealth outside of salary. 
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143067
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143343

attributes.action: Abolish the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge
attributes.background:
Abolish the Government's high income child benefit tax charge for an individual income exceeding £50,000 introduced in January 2013. 

This tax charge effects families when a individual parent income exceeds the threshold.  This tax charge means they are no longer eligible for full child benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many instances where an individual parent income is the only source of income for an entire family.  

This tax charge isn't proportionate or fair when compared to a joint couple who's combined income can potentially reach £100,000 and not be subject to any child benefit tax charge. 

This tax charge needs to be abolished it's horrendously unfair and discriminates against many families.  A tax system should be fair across the board, this certainly isn't.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/9788481/Abolish-child-benefit-and-give-families-a-tax-break.html

attributes.action: SUSPEND THE £118,000,000.00 GIVEN BY UK TO BURMA THIS YEAR INDEFINITELY
attributes.background:
Britain must save money,especially before uncertain times like BREXIT, when ID CHECKS at hospitals are proposed,the question is,why's BURMA set to receive £118 million from the British taxpayer
when clearly committing crimes against humanity,
and addressing it is the responsibility of all humanity
attributes.additional_details:
PM meeting with Burmese State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi: 13/09/16 -Downing Street spokesperson said: "The Prime Minister said we stood ready to provide further assistance as Burma continues to develop, including through £118 million in support this year."

Yale study suggested that the abuse of the more than one million Rohingya may amount to genocide;a confidential United Nations report to the Security Council says it may constitute “crimes against humanity under international criminal law.”

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: Make schools relax their uniform policies
attributes.background: Schools are turning pupils away due to uniform violations which disrupts a child's education. Schools should be made to relax these draconian policies. A parent is fined for taking their child out in term time, yet schools openly send children home. Clothing does not have a bearing on education!
attributes.additional_details:
Why do schools think it's ok to disrupt a child's education in this way? This denies children the education they are entitled to. The strict uniform policies are often discriminatory and unfair, if not petty.
School uniforms are a part of school life, this is accepted, but why does the 'wrong colour' black shoe or wrong type of material matter?  A child's education should matter more than the cut of their clothing. Make schools relax their policies to ensure all children are treated fairly!

attributes.action: Make it an offence to repeatedly tell someone to kill themselves
attributes.background:
It has been on the news today of the girl that was bullied and told to hang herself.  Who then sadly committed suicide.
 I have been in a similar situation. Fortunately my daughter survived after being driven to attempt suicide due to bullying where she was told to kill herself.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-85296/Suicide-girl-aged-13-bullied-6ft.html

attributes.action: Regulate vehicle techs to only allow qualified  people to repair motor vehicles
attributes.background: Currently any person can repair  their own or anyone else's vehicle with no training or experience of motor  vehicles. Eg replace their brake with disastrous or fatal results. Other trades are regulated to stop untrained people  from carrying out dangerous  repair work  Eg gas fitters and elections
attributes.additional_details:
Other concerns  are electric  cars
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/life-style/motoring/motoring-news/electric-cars-mechanics-with-no-specialist-training-risk-death-when-tinkering-with-the-vehicles-a6816786.html%3famp
13% of road accidents are cause by mechanical failure or poorly service vehicles. Regulation  would cut accidents and possibly save lives

attributes.action: Government to pay NHS £5bn Brexit bonus from 2019/20 and every year thereafter.
attributes.background: Now that MP's have voted to trigger Article 50 the Government should stick to the promises made during the Brexit campaign.  Although the well publicised figure of £350m per week isn't realistic I would like to see them pledge a Brexit bonus of £5bn for 2019/20 and every year thereafter.

attributes.action: Stop fines to parents who holiday in term time or stop companies raising prices.
attributes.background: It's not fair or right for holiday companies to raise prices during school holidays and for local authorities to fine parents for taking their children out of school during term time. Some companies charge hundred so of pounds more and the majority of ordinary working people are being penalised.
attributes.additional_details: It's not difficult to find the evidence just search for any holiday during term time and check the dates either side of the school holidays!

attributes.action: Amend the curriculum to include race relations as a compulsory area of study.
attributes.background: The state of race relations in the UK (and Europe) is worse than it has ever been during the course of my life. The concept of racial equality and appreciation of other religions, cultures and ethnicities must be taught from primary school onwards, so as to ensure that the UK operates harmoniously.
attributes.additional_details: Racial divide and the concept of the 'foreign other' is not natural. No child is born to notice that others are of a different skin tone to them - it is something that society engrains in us over time. Children must be taught that we are all equal for this country to truly prosper and lead from the front. Almost all hate crimes could be avoided if people were taught about racial equality from primary school onwards. The PM must be more proactive and not shirk her responsibility in this regard.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to walk a dog in a public place without a lead on
attributes.background: I am seeing a lot of dog attacks lately that could have been avoided if the dog was on a lead. I think it should be the law that all dogs are on a lead in a public place

attributes.action: Stop schools from giving awards for 100% attendance.
attributes.background: Schools often issue awards for children who attain 100% attendance. Apart from the fact that this discriminates against many children who have medical appointments which cannot be arranged out of term time, absence from school for certain illnesses is required, making 100% attendance impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the childhood illnesses children contract are caught from their classmates, at school. Many of these illnesses, such as chicken pox, rotavirus and impetigo, require children to be absent from school for a minimum period of time before returning. This means the 100% attendance award is an impossibility and awarding it to children who have somehow managed not to suffer from these illnesses throughout the school year makes other children feel inadequate. It's discriminatory and must stop.

attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
• Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

• Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

• Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

• Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

• Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities – caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: To Exempt Final Year Uni students From Council Tax, For Their Entire Tenancy.
attributes.background: The government demand that final year Uni students pay council tax for the period between the conclusion of final term right up until the end of your tenancy. This is regardless of the length of your contract (often demanded by landlords to be 11 months) and the fact that you signed it as a student.
attributes.additional_details: My housemates and I feel we were not sufficiently warned or provided any clear statements to make us aware of this law and feel that either this approach must be changed, or that the demand for council tax over these outlying months, be removed completely. We want to help raise awareness for other students so that they don't get caught out too. As graduates we don't earn too much straight after University and to be suddenly hit with a bill that we were unaware of is quite stressful.

attributes.action: Ban all schools from using mini buses.
attributes.background:
Schools drive pupils/students around in mini buses on basic car licences.
Ban all schools from doing this unless they employ a qualified PCV licence holder with up to date CPC card.
attributes.additional_details:
If schools had to use coach companies it would create jobs and boost business.
All drivers are qualified and CRB checked so children would be safe still.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 years in prison for possession of indecent photograph of a child
attributes.background: I think it's very shocking that people found in possession of child porn (criminal justice act 1988 section 160) get maximum of 5 years prison. This should be changed straight away and I think personally they should be locked up for life, but I know this ain't realistic for the government.
attributes.additional_details: This is to out of date and should be changed straight away as well as criminal justice act 1978 section 1

attributes.action: We call for a special task force to combat 'Post Brexit Hate Crimes'
attributes.background: I have lived in Norwich all my life and later in a small village. Working in the building industry with some of the hardest working EU nationals. I believe every life is precious and we should as good people embrace every human being who wish to embrace our culture.
attributes.additional_details: I am from Norwich which is a lovely City where people got on well, but then come Brexit . I have watched a local Polish shop been burnt out in an arson attack. EU nationals friends can no longer hold their head up and they feel shamed by the nasty finger pointing, racial slurs and agression.

attributes.action: Don't allow travel firms to increase fares during school holidays
attributes.background: As hard working people we like to enjoy time away with our families. Yet from both ends we are penalised, fines for taking children out of school or double/triple fares during the holidays. If these companies stopped taking advantage I'm sure you would see a vast change in the absences at school.

attributes.action: Put a stop to Annualised/Banked Hours contracts in workplaces.
attributes.background: The government needs to abolish the Banked/Annualised Hours contracts in workplaces. Employees are working over the working time directive, where the additional overtime is banked. This should be paid at a normal or premium rate as standard.
attributes.additional_details: Employees who work under this scheme have to constantly monitor hours that are either "Banked" or "Owed". Sometimes working unsociable hours, or days where the employer will then tactically either stand down employee from shift to ensure further hours are not "Banked", or put unreasonable requests to employees to make up hours "owed".

attributes.action: Repeal ALL anti-smoking legislation.
attributes.background: Smoking tobacco is a legal past time, the Government has no legitimate right to restrict a legal activity.  The covering up of cigarettes in shops is ridiculous and counter productive.  Plain packaging does not work.  The high taxation is counter productive and encourages smuggling.

attributes.action: British Government to reconsider its decision to renew the Lease on Chagos
attributes.background: The British Government decided to stop resettlement of the Chagossians. The Government should stop the renewal of the Lease in December 2016. If proceeds the natives would be too old or be dead in 2036, when  the lease expires.  Exiled for over 40 years. Join me in condemning this decision.
attributes.additional_details: The British Government has recently made £40M available in a pot to assist the Chagossians over the next 10 years. The sum is not sufficient to redress the wrong-doings by the Government and instead a more legitimate programme for resettlement of the Chagossians should be considered, wherever the Chagossians are today, irrespective of their current circumstances.  All the Chagossians HAVE BEEN UPROOTED and therefore should EACH be treated equally in benefiting from any form of redress.

attributes.action: Debate Autism and Employment
attributes.background: As somebody on the Autism Spectrum I currently claim Jobseeker's Allowance and I feel that I have not been given any support to look for a job and they don't understand Autism or how to help people like me to get into employment.
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be people trained in Autism within the DWP as the advisors I have seen do not seem to understand people like me at all, this leads to me feeling very emotional and stressed out, and I dread attending the jobcentre as I really dislike being there, you literally get 5 minutes to be seen then your out the door.
